target_audience.primary_persona: IT Help Desk staff and system administrators at TTCU (Tinker Federal Credit Union) who need to quickly look up employee/user information across multiple identity systems
secondary_personas: IT Security personnel conducting access audits
HR administrators verifying employee system access
Contact center managers checking agent configurations in Genesys
pain_points: Searching multiple identity systems separately (AD, Azure AD, Genesys) is time-consuming
Correlating user data across systems manually is error-prone
Tracking who has access to what systems for compliance audits is difficult
No single view of employee identity and system access
Manual verification of job role to system role compliance
goals: Quickly find any employee across all identity systems with a single search
View consolidated employee profile with data from multiple sources
Audit user access and role compliance across systems
Reduce time spent on identity lookups from minutes to seconds
Maintain security and compliance with role-based access control
target_audience.usage_context: Used during IT support calls, security audits, HR onboarding/offboarding, and compliance reviews in an enterprise environment with Azure AD SSO authentication

product_vision.one_liner: A comprehensive Flask-based identity lookup service that provides unified search across Active Directory, Microsoft Graph, and Genesys Cloud with enterprise-grade security and compliance features.
product_vision.problem_statement: Enterprise IT teams waste significant time searching multiple disconnected identity systems when supporting employees, conducting audits, or verifying access - leading to slower support resolution, inconsistent data, and compliance gaps.
product_vision.value_proposition: WhoDis consolidates identity data from LDAP, Microsoft Graph, and Genesys Cloud into a single, secure, audited interface - enabling IT staff to find any user in seconds with complete context across all systems.
success_metrics: Time to find user information reduced from minutes to seconds
100% of identity searches audited and traceable
Zero unauthorized access incidents (role-based access working)
Job role compliance violations detected and reported
High user adoption rate among IT staff

existing_features: Multi-source identity search (LDAP, Graph API, Genesys Cloud)
Smart result merging across identity providers
User profile photos from Microsoft Graph
Job role compliance matrix for access auditing
User notes feature for internal documentation
known_gaps: No REST API endpoints for external integrations
No workflow automation for access requests
technical_debt: Test framework not implemented (pytest mentioned but not configured)
Some SQLAlchemy models detected in venv (project index parsing issue)
License file not specified in README

alternatives: Individual system admin consoles (AD, Genesys, etc.)
differentiators: Purpose-built for credit union/TTCU environment with specific integrations
Unified search across AD, Graph, AND Genesys (contact center specific)
Lightweight Flask-based solution vs. heavy enterprise platforms
Job role compliance matrix specifically for audit requirements
Modern HTMX interface vs. legacy admin consoles
competitive_context.market_position: Internal enterprise tool optimized for credit union IT operations, combining identity management with contact center integration - a niche not well-served by generic IAM platforms or contact center tools alone.

technical: Depends on Azure AD for authentication (SSO via App Service headers)
Requires network access to LDAP, Microsoft Graph API, and Genesys Cloud APIs
Encryption key management (WHODIS_ENCRYPTION_KEY must be secured)
resources: Appears to be maintained by single developer or small team (based on git history)
Internal TTCU tool - likely limited development resources
No dedicated QA or testing infrastructure currently
dependencies: Microsoft Graph API access and credentials
Azure App Service for SSO header injection
SQL Server data warehouse (for job role compliance sync)
